item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Aretha Franklin
item.description: "The man who gets me is getting one hell of a woman." -- Aretha Franklin

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Evan Esar
item.description: "Success is the good fortune that comes from aspiration, desperation, perspiration,and inspiration." -- Evan Esar

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Tobias Smollett
item.description: "The capital is become an overgrown monster; which like a dropsical head, will in time leave the body and extremities without nourishment and support." -- Tobias Smollett

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There was no being displeased with such an encourager, for his admiration made him discern a likeness before it was possible." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "How quick come the reasons for approving what we like." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Mary Shelley
item.description: "The fallen angel becomes a malignant devil." -- Mary Shelley

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by James Hogg
item.description: "With regard to the work itself, I dare not venture a judgment, for I do not understand it." -- James Hogg

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "The owl goes not into the nest of the lark." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Gold conjures up a mist about a man, more destructive of all his old senses and lulling to his feelings than the fumes of charcoal." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "There is neither happiness nor misery in the world; there is only the comparison of one state with another, nothing more. He who has felt the deepest grief is best able to experience supreme happiness. We must have felt what it is to die, Morrel, that we may appreciate the enjoyments of life. " Live, then, and be happy, beloved children of my heart, and never forget, that until the day God will deign to reveal the future to man, all human wisdom is contained in these two words, 'Wait and Hope." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by William Thackeray
item.description: "I knew all along that the prize I had set my life on was not worth the winning." -- William Thackeray

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "Our deeds determine us, as much as we determine our deeds." -- George Eliot

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "If I got places, sir, it was because I made myself fit for 'em. If you want to slip into a round hole, you must first make a ball of yourself; that's where it is." -- George Eliot

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "The more conscious I was of goodness and of all that was 'sublime and beautiful,'the more deeply I sank into my mire and the more ready I was to sink in it altogether." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Erica Jong
item.description: "Advice is what we ask for when we already know the answer but wish we didnâ€™t." -- Erica Jong

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "People, generally, suck." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Catamorandi add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare
